_header: To speak of science craft or sapience
Title(s): ‘Learning vain without guid lyfe’; ‘Dunbar at Oxenfurde’
_description: William Dunbar, ‘Learning vain without guid lyfe’ or ‘Dunbar at Oxenfurde’ — three 8-line stanzas with refrain, ‘A paralous lyfe is vain prosperitie’

CULLl510.First Lines:
To speik of science craft or sapienceOff vertew morall cunning or
                    doctryne…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…ȝour maist accusar is ȝour awin cuningAnd perrelous
                    is vane prosperitie
CULLl510.Note:
3 x 8, ababbcbc, incl. refrain, ‘Ane perrelous lyf is vain
                    prosperitie’.

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
To Speik of science craft or Sapienceoff vertew morall cwnnyng or
                    doctrene…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…ȝour maist accusar salle ȝour awin cwnningA parolus
                    seiknes is vane prosperite
